tasks: Review and apply the 10 Usability Heuristics for User Interface Design (nngroup.com) to a current project, focusing on at least 3 of the heuristics. Document your thought process and decisions in a 2-page report.
Create a simple wireframe of a hypothetical product feature using Hick’s Law as a guide. Identify 3 potential pitfalls and suggest mitigations.
Write a short reflection (1 page) on how Tesler’s Law applies to your current work, including specific examples or scenarios where it might impact user experience.
Conduct a self-assessment of your Product Thinking & Strategy skills using the 'What would I do differently?' framework. Identify 3 areas for improvement and create a 1-page plan to address them.
Redesign the navigation menu for your portfolio using the 8-point grid system, ensuring accessibility and clear hierarchy. Document your design decisions in a 2-page report.
Create a simple prototype of a hypothetical product feature using Aesthetic-Usability Effect as a guide. Test it with 3 users and gather feedback to iterate on.
Develop a comprehensive plan for improving your Product Thinking & Strategy skills, including specific courses, books, or workshops you'd like to take. Present your plan in a 2-page report.
Create a user journey map for a current project, highlighting pain points and areas for improvement. Use the Jobs-to-be-Done framework to identify potential solutions.
Design a new product feature using Laws of UX as a guide. Test it with 3 users and gather feedback to iterate on.
Create a comprehensive portfolio piece that showcases your improved Product Thinking & Strategy skills, including a written explanation of your design decisions.
Develop a strategic plan for improving user research and validation processes in your current projects. Present your plan in a 2-page report.
Conduct an internal UX audit of your company's products or services, identifying areas for improvement and proposing solutions using the Laws of UX as a guide.

resources.readup: As a Strategic Lead UX designer, you have the unique opportunity to drive business growth through user-centered design, leveraging your expertise in UX Fundamentals, UI Craft & Visual Design, User Research & Validation, and Product Thinking & Strategy. By combining your skills with exceptional collaboration and communication abilities, you can lead cross-functional teams to create innovative solutions that exceed user expectations and propel your organization forward.

resources.title: 10 Usability Heuristics for User Interface Design
resources.description: 7 10 Usability Heuristics for User Interface Design ================================================= Jakob Nielsen ![](https://media.nngroup.com/medi...

topics.name: Understanding Hick's Law and its Application in UX Design
topics.summary: As a Strategic Lead, it's crucial to understand the limitations of user interaction time and how it affects design decisions.
practice_points: Analyze 3 existing websites using Hick's Law as a framework for evaluating navigation patterns and identify opportunities for improvement
Create a case study on how Hick's Law influenced the design of a successful product feature
Design an A/B test to validate the impact of Hick's Law on user behavior

topics.name: Developing a Comprehensive Style Guide with Tesler’s Law in Mind
topics.summary: As a Strategic Lead, it's essential to create a style guide that balances aesthetics and usability, considering the cognitive biases of users.
practice_points: Research 5 existing style guides and analyze how they incorporate Tesler’s Law principles
Create a sample style guide with typography, color, and spacing tokens that adhere to Tesler’s Law
Conduct user testing on a design concept using a style guide developed with Tesler’s Law in mind

topics.name: Applying the Zeigarnik Effect in User Research and Validation
topics.summary: As a Strategic Lead, it's vital to understand how to leverage the Zeigarnik Effect to uncover user motivations and pain points.
practice_points: Conduct 2 interviews using the Zeigarnik Effect framework to identify user goals and motivations
Analyze 3 existing user research studies that applied the Zeigarnik Effect and extract key findings
Design an experiment to validate the impact of the Zeigarnik Effect on user behavior
